unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Bolster Adoption in Maharashtra**
normalised: Energy and Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Bolster Adoption in Maharashtra

unnormalised: Mumbai, November 7, 2024 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has announced an enhanced subsidy program for residential solar rooftop installations, aiming to accelerate the adoption of renewable energy across the state.
normalised: Mumbai, seventh November two thousand and twenty four – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L) has announced an enhanced subsidy program for residential solar rooftop installations, aiming to accelerate the adoption of renewable energy across the state.

unnormalised: Under the revised scheme, eligible homeowners can now avail subsidies of up to 40% on solar systems up to 3kW capacity. For systems ranging from 3kW to 10kW, a 20% subsidy will be applicable. This initiative significantly reduces the upfront cost, making solar power more accessible to middle-class families, like the Sharmas in Pune who are planning a 500 sq ft installation.
normalised: Under the revised scheme, eligible homeowners can now avail subsidies of up to forty percent on solar systems up to three kilowatt capacity. For systems ranging from three kilowatt to ten kilowatt, a twenty percent subsidy will be applicable. This initiative significantly reduces the upfront cost, making solar power more accessible to middle-class families, like the Sharmas in Pune who are planning a five hundred square feet installation.

unnormalised: Dr. Anil Kumar, MSEDCL Chairman, stated that the goal is to reach 50,000 new rooftop installations by the end of FY25. The subsidies are expected to encourage citizens to embrace "Atmanirbhar Bharat" in energy consumption.
normalised: Doctor Anil Kumar, M S E D C L Chairman, stated that the goal is to reach fifty thousand new rooftop installations by the end of F Y twenty five. The subsidies are expected to encourage citizens to embrace "Atmanirbhar Bharat" in energy consumption.

unnormalised: The government allocates Rs. 500 Crores for the scheme. Applications can be submitted online through the MSEDCL portal. Experts predict a positive impact on local solar panel manufacturers as demand surges in cities like Nagpur and Aurangabad. The scheme also includes provisions for net metering, allowing homeowners to sell excess power back to the grid, further reducing their electricity bills.
normalised: The government allocates rupee five hundred crore for the scheme. Applications can be submitted online through the M S E D C L portal. Experts predict a positive impact on local solar panel manufacturers as demand surges in cities like Nagpur and Aurangabad. The scheme also includes provisions for net metering, allowing homeowners to sell excess power back to the grid, further reducing their electricity bills.
